title: Citi Ranks as #1 Cash Management Provider in Latin America in the Euromoney Cash Management Poll 2013
summary: Miami, Florida - Non-financial institutions chose Citi as the no. 1 Regional Cash Management Bank in Latin America for the seventh consecutive year in Euromoney's prestigious annual Cash Management Survey 2013. Furthermore, the bank has been ranked by non-financial institutions as the Best Domestic Cash Management Bank in Argentina, Peru, and Uruguay, second best in Venezuela and Mexico (Banamex), and third best in Colombia. Additionally, financial institutions ranked Citi among the top 5 in dollar, euro, sterling, and yen transactions in Latin America.
tag-1: Citi Ranks as #1 Cash Management Provider in Latin America in the Euromoney Cash Management Poll 2013
tag-3: Miami, Florida – Non-financial institutions chose Citi as the no. 1 Regional Cash Management Bank in Latin America for the seventh consecutive year in Euromoney's prestigious annual Cash Management Survey 2013. Furthermore, the bank has been ranked by non-financial institutions as the Best Domestic Cash Management Bank in Argentina, Peru, and Uruguay, second best in Venezuela and Mexico (Banamex), and third best in Colombia. Additionally, financial institutions ranked Citi among the top 5 in dollar, euro, sterling, and yen transactions in Latin America.
tag-4: "Citi's continued recognition by our clients in these prestigious surveys, both at a regional and country levels, distinguish our sustained efforts to deliver the best service solutions. We are very proud of the recognitions received and are committed to investing in innovation and leading Cash Management products and services in Latin America," said Fernando Iraola, Latin America Region Head, Treasury and Trade Solutions.
tag-5: Euromoney has been conducting the Cash Management Poll since 2001 and is considered to be one of the most respected surveys in the financial services industry.
tag-6: The Euromoney Cash Management Survey uses a methodology that involves polling cash managers, treasurers and financial officers worldwide. The survey is split into a non-financial institutions questionnaire and a financial institutions questionnaire. Respondents are asked to indicate which three banks they currently use most for their cash management services.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
